   20: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
   21: %%% Purpose:Test Suite for the 'erl_pp' module.
   22: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   23: -module(erl_pp_SUITE).
   24: 
   25: %%-define(debug, true).
   26: 
   27: -ifdef(debug).
   28: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   29: -define(config(X,Y), foo).
   30: -define(datadir, "erl_pp_SUITE_data").
   31: -define(privdir, "erl_pp_SUITE_priv").
   32: -define(t, test_server).
   33: -else.
   34: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   35: -define(datadir, proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)).
   36: -define(privdir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)).
   37: -endif.
   38: 
   39: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   40: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   41: 	 init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   42: 
   43: -export([ func/1, call/1, recs/1, try_catch/1, if_then/1,
   44: 	  receive_after/1, bits/1, head_tail/1,
   45: 	  cond1/1, block/1, case1/1, ops/1, messages/1,
   46: 	  import_export/1, misc_attrs/1, dialyzer_attrs/1,
   47: 	  hook/1,
   48: 	  neg_indent/1,
   49: 	  maps_syntax/1,
   50: 	  format_options/1,
   51:           form_vars/1,
   52: 	  quoted_atom_types/1,
   53: 
   54: 	  otp_6321/1, otp_6911/1, otp_6914/1, otp_8150/1, otp_8238/1,
   55: 	  otp_8473/1, otp_8522/1, otp_8567/1, otp_8664/1, otp_9147/1,
   56:           otp_10302/1, otp_10820/1, otp_11100/1, otp_11861/1, pr_1014/1,
   57:           otp_13662/1, otp_14285/1, otp_15592/1, otp_15751/1, otp_15755/1,
   58:           otp_16435/1, gh_5093/1,
   59:           eep49/1, eep58/1]).
   60: 
   61: %% Internal export.
   62: -export([ehook/6]).
   63: 
   64: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   68:     ok.
   69: 
   70: suite() ->
   71:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   72:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   73: 
   74: all() -> 
   75:     [{group, expr}, {group, attributes}, hook, neg_indent,
   76:      {group, tickets}].
   77: 
   78: groups() -> 
   79:     [{expr, [],
   80:       [func, call, recs, try_catch, if_then, receive_after,
   81:        bits, head_tail, cond1, block, case1, ops,
   82:        messages, maps_syntax, quoted_atom_types,
   83:        format_options, form_vars
   84:     ]},
   85:      {attributes, [], [misc_attrs, import_export, dialyzer_attrs]},
   86:      {tickets, [],
   87:       [otp_6321, otp_6911, otp_6914, otp_8150, otp_8238,
   88:        otp_8473, otp_8522, otp_8567, otp_8664, otp_9147,
   89:        otp_10302, otp_10820, otp_11100, otp_11861, pr_1014, otp_13662,
   90:        otp_14285, otp_15592, otp_15751, otp_15755, otp_16435,
   91:        gh_5093, eep49, eep58]}].
   92: 
   93: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   94:     Config.
   95: 
   96: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   97:     ok.
   98: 
   99: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  100:     Config.
  101: 
  102: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  103:     Config.
  104: 
  105: 
  106: 
  107: func(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  108:     Ts = [{func_1,
  109:            <<"-record(r1, {a,b}).
  110:               -record(r3, {a = fun(_) -> #r1{} end(1), b}).
  111: 
  112:               t() ->
  113:                   fun(A) when is_record(A#r3.a, r1) -> 7 end(#r3{}).
  114:              ">>},
  115:           {func_2,
  116:            <<"-record(r1, {a,b}).
  117:               -record(r3, {a = fun(_) -> #r1{} end(1), b}).
  118: 
  119:               t() ->
  120:                   fsdfsdfjsdfjkljf:sdlfjdsfjlf(
  121:                       fun(sdfsd) -> {sdkjsdf,sdfjsdkljfsdl,sdfkjdklf} end).
  122:              ">>},
  123:           {func_3,
  124:            <<"t() -> fun t/0.">>},
  125:           {func_4,
  126:            <<"t() -> fun modul:foo/3.">>},
  127:           {func_5, % 'when' is moved down one line
  128:            <<"tkjlksjflksdjflsdjlk()
  129:                  when kljlsajflksjdfklsjdlkjfklsdklfjsdlf <
  130:                       kljasjfdsjflsdjfklsdjfklsdjfklsd ->
  131:                  foo.">>},
  132:           {func_6,
  133:            <<"t() ->
  134:                   (fun() ->
  135:                            true
  136:                    end)().">>},
  137: 	  {func_7,
  138:            <<"t(M, F, A) -> fun M:F/A.">>},
  139:           {func_8,
  140:            <<"-record(r1, {a,b}).
  141:               -record(r3, {a = fun Id(_) -> #r1{} end(1), b}).
  142: 
  143:               t() ->
  144:                   fun Id(A) when is_record(A#r3.a, r1) -> 7 end(#r3{}).
  145:              ">>},
  146:           {func_9,
  147:            <<"-record(r1, {a,b}).
  148:               -record(r3, {a = fun Id(_) -> #r1{} end(1), b}).
  149: 
  150:               t() ->
  151:                   fsdfsdfjsdfjkljf:sdlfjdsfjlf(
  152:                       fun Id(sdfsd) -> {sdkjsdf,sdfjsdkljfsdl,sdfkjdklf} end).
  153:              ">>},
  154:           {func_10,
  155:            <<"t() ->
  156:                   (fun True() ->
  157:                            true
  158:                    end)().">>}
  159:           ],
  160:     compile(Config, Ts),
  161:     ok.
  162: 
  163: call(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  164:     Ts = [{call_1,
  165:            <<"t() ->
  166:                   fookjljsflj:barlkjlkjsdfj(kjdslfjsdl,hej,san,sa,
  167:                       foo,sdfds,sdfsdf,sdfsd,sdfdsf,sdfdsf,sfdsf,
  168:                       sfds,sdfsdf,sfds).
  169:              ">>}
  170:           ],
  171:     compile(Config, Ts),
  172:     ok.
  173: 
  174: recs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  175:     %% Evolved while testing strict record tests in guards...
  176:     Ts = [{recs_1,
  177:            <<"-compile(strict_record_tests).
  178:               -record(r, {a = 4,b}).
  179:               -record(r1, {a,b}).
  180:               -record(r2, {a = #r1{},b,c=length([1,2,3])}).
  181:               -record(r3, {a = fun(_) -> #r1{} end(1), b}).
  182:               -record(r4, {a = fun R1(_) -> #r1{} end(1), b}).
  183: 
  184:               t() ->
  185:                   foo = fun(A) when A#r1.a > A#r1.b -> foo end(#r1{b = 2}),
  186:                   0 = fun(A) when A#r2.a -> 0 end(#r2{a = true}),
  187:                   1 = fun(A) when (#r1{a = A})#r1.a > 2 -> 1 end(3),
  188:                   2 = fun(N) when ((#r2{a = #r{a = 4}, b = length([a,b,c])})#r2.a)#r.a > N ->
  189:                               2 end(2),
  190:                   3 = fun(A) when (A#r2.a)#r1.a =:= 3 -> 3 end(#r2{a = #r1{a = 3}}),
  191:                   ok = fun() ->
  192:                                F = fun(A) when is_record(A#r.a, r1) -> 4;
  193:                                       (A) when is_record(A#r1.a, r1) -> 5
  194:                                    end,
  195:                                5 = F(#r1{a = #r1{}}),
  196:                                4 = F(#r{a = #r1{}}),
  197:                                ok
  198:                        end(),
  199:                   3 = fun(A) when is_record(A#r1.a, r),
  200:                                         (A#r1.a)#r.a > 3 -> 3
  201:                       end(#r1{a = #r{a = 4}}),
  202:                   7 = fun(A) when is_record(A#r3.a, r1) -> 7 end(#r3{}),
  203:                   [#r1{a = 2,b = 1}] =
  204:                       fun() ->
  205:                               [A || A <- [#r1{a = 1, b = 3},
  206:                                           #r2{a = 2,b = 1},
  207:                                           #r1{a = 2, b = 1}],
  208:                                     A#r1.a >
  209:                                         A#r1.b]
  210:                       end(),
  211:                   {[_],b} =
  212:                       fun(L) ->
  213:                               %% A is checked only once:
  214:                               R1 = [{A,B} || A <- L, A#r1.a, B <- L, A#r1.b],
  215:                               A = #r2{a = true},
  216:                               %% A is checked again:
  217:                               B = if A#r1.a -> a; true -> b end,
  218:                               {R1,B}
  219:                       end([#r1{a = true, b = true}]),
  220: 
  221:                   p = fun(A) when (A#r1.a =:= 2) or (A#r2.a =:= 1) -> o;
  222:                          (_) -> p
  223:                       end(#r1{a = 2}),
  224: 
  225:                   o = fun(A) when (A#r1.a =:= 2) orelse (A#r2.a =:= 1) -> o;
  226:                          (_) -> p
  227:                       end(#r1{a = 2}),
  228: 
  229:                   %% The test done twice (an effect of doing the test as soon as possible).
  230:                   3 = fun(A) when A#r1.a > 3,
  231:                                   is_record(A, r1) -> 3
  232:                       end(#r1{a = 5}),
  233: 
  234:                   ok = fun() ->
  235:                                F = fun(A) when (A#r2.a =:= 1) orelse (A#r2.a) -> 2;
  236:                                       (A) when (A#r1.a =:= 1) orelse (A#r1.a) -> 1;
  237:                                       (A) when (A#r2.a =:= 2) andalso (A#r2.b) -> 3
  238:                                    end,
  239:                                1 = F(#r1{a = 1}),
  240:                                2 = F(#r2{a = true}),
  241:                                3 = F(#r2{a = 2, b = true}),
  242:                                ok
  243:                        end(),
  244: 
  245:                   b = fun(A) when false or not (A#r.a =:= 1) -> a;
  246:                          (_) -> b
  247:                       end(#r1{a = 1}),
  248:                   b = fun(A) when not (A#r.a =:= 1) or false -> a;
  249:                          (_) -> b
  250:                       end(#r1{a = 1}),
  251: 
  252:                   ok = fun() ->
  253:                                F = fun(A) when not (A#r.a =:= 1) -> yes;
  254:                                       (_) -> no
  255:                                    end,
  256:                                no = F(#r1{a = 2}),
  257:                                yes = F(#r{a = 2}),
  258:                                no = F(#r{a = 1}),
  259:                                ok
  260:                        end(),
  261: 
  262:                   %% No extra check added:
  263:                   a = fun(A) when erlang:is_record(A, r),
  264:                                   A#r.a =:= 1,
  265:                                   A#r.b =:= 2 -> a
  266:                       end(#r{a = 1, b = 2}),
  267:                   a = fun(A) when is_record(A, r),
  268:                                   A#r.a =:= 1,
  269:                                   A#r.b =:= 2 -> a
  270:                       end(#r{a = 1, b = 2}),
  271: 
  272:                   nop = fun(A) when (is_record(A, r1) and (A#r1.a > 3)) or (A#r2.a < 1) ->
  273:                                 japp;
  274:                            (_) ->
  275:                                 nop
  276:                         end(#r2{a = 0}),
  277:                   nop = fun(A) when (A#r1.a > 3) or (A#r2.a < 1) -> japp;
  278:                            (_) ->
  279:                                 nop
  280:                         end(#r2{a = 0}),
  281: 
  282:                   ok = fun() ->
  283:                                F = fun(A) when (A#r1.a =:= 2) or (A#r2.a =:= 1) -> o;
  284:                                       (_) -> p
  285:                                    end,
  286:                                p = F(#r2{a = 1}),
  287:                                p = F(#r1{a = 2}),
  288:                                ok
  289:                        end(),
  290: 
  291:                   ok = fun() ->
  292:                                F = fun(A) when fail, A#r1.a; A#r1.a -> ab;
  293:                                       (_) -> bu
  294:                                    end,
  295:                                ab = F(#r1{a = true}),
  296:                                bu = F(#r2{a = true}),
  297:                                ok
  298:                        end(),
  299: 
  300:                   both = fun(A) when A#r.a, A#r.b -> both
  301:                          end(#r{a = true, b = true}),
  302: 
  303:                   ok = fun() ->
  304:                                F = fun(A, B) when ((A#r1.a) orelse (B#r2.a))
  305:                                                   or (B#r2.b) or (A#r1.b) ->
  306:                                          true;
  307:                                       (_, _) -> false
  308:                                    end,
  309:                                true = F(#r1{a = false, b = false},
  310:                                         #r2{a = false, b = true}),
  311:                                false = F(#r1{a = true, b = true},
  312:                                          #r1{a = false, b = true}),
  313:                                ok
  314:                        end(),
  315: 
  316:                   ok.
  317:              ">>},
  318:           {recs_2,
  319:            <<"-record(r1, {a, b = foo:bar(kljlfjsdlf, kjlksdjf)}).
  320:               -record(r2, {c = #r1{}, d = #r1{a = bar:foo(kljklsjdf)}}).
  321: 
  322:               t() ->
  323:                   R = #r2{},
  324:                   R#r2{c = R, d = #r1{}}.">>}
  325:           ],
  326:     compile(Config, Ts),
  327: 
  328:     ok = pp_expr(<<"case #r{a={1,2},b=#r{}} of
  329:                               X=Y=#r{a=foo,b=bar} ->
  330:                                   {(foooo:baaaar(X))#r{a = rep},Y,#r.b}
  331:                           end">>),
  332:     ok = pp_expr(<<"R#r{a = {kljasdklf,sdkfjsdl,sdafjkllsdf,sdfkjsd,
  333:                           sdafjsd,sdf,sdafsd,sdfdsf,sdfdsf,dsfds}}">>),
  334:     ok.
  335: 
  336: try_catch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  337:     Ts = [{try_1, % copied from erl_eval_SUITE
  338:            <<"t() -> try 1 of 1 -> 2 catch _:_ -> 3 end.">>},
  339:           {try_2,
  340:            <<"t() -> try 1 of 1 -> 2; 3 -> 4 catch _:_ -> 5 end.">>},
  341:           {try_3,
  342:            <<"t() -> try 3 of 1 -> 2; 3 -> 4 catch _:_ -> 5 end.">>},
  343:           {try_4,
  344:            <<"t() -> try 1 after put(try_catch, 2) end.">>},
  345:           {try_5,
  346:            <<"t() -> try 1 of 1 -> 2; 3 -> 4
  347:    	             after put(try_catch, 5) end.">>},
  348:           {try_6,
  349:            <<"t() -> try 1=2 catch throw:{badmatch,2} -> 3 end.">>},
  350:           {try_7,
  351:            <<"t() -> try 1=2 of 3 -> 4
  352: 		     catch error:{badmatch,2} -> 5 end.">>},
  353:           {try_8,
  354:            <<"t() -> try 1=2
  355: 		     catch error:{badmatch,2} -> 3
  356: 		     after put(try_catch, 4) end.">>},
  357:           {try_9,
  358:            <<"t() -> try 1=2
  359: 		     catch error:{badmatch,2} -> 3
  360: 		     after put(try_catch, 4) end.">>},
  361:           {try_10,
  362:            <<"t() -> try a,b,c
  363:                          catch exit:_ -> d;
  364:                                throw:_ -> t;
  365:                                error:{foo,bar} -> foo,
  366:                                                   bar
  367:                          end.">>},
  368: 
  369:           {catch_1,
  370:            <<"t() -> catch foo.">>},
  371:           {catch_2,
  372:            <<"t() -> case catch foo of bar -> foo end.">>},
  373:           {catch_3,
  374:            <<"t() -> catch begin begin foo, bar, foo:bar(kljsldkfjdls,kljsdl),
  375:                            catch bar:foo(foo) end end.">>}
  376:           ],
  377:     compile(Config, Ts),
  378:     ok = pp_expr(<<"try
  379:                               erl_internal:bif(M,F,length(Args))
  380:                           of
  381:                               true ->
  382:                                   call(N,Args,Prec,Hook);
  383:                               false ->
  384:                                   call(Name,Args,Prec,Hook)
  385:                           after foo end">>),
  386:     ok.
  387: 
  388: if_then(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  389:     Ts = [{if_1,
  390:            <<"t() -> if 1 > 2 -> 1; true -> b end.">>},
  391:           {if_2,
  392:            <<"t() -> if true -> true end.">>},
  393:           {if_3,
  394:            <<"t() -> if 1 == 2 -> a; 1 > 2 -> b; 1 < 2 -> c end.">>}
  395:           ],
  396:     compile(Config, Ts),
  397:     ok.
  398: 
  399: receive_after(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  400:     Ts = [{rec_1,
  401:            <<"t() -> receive foo -> bar; bar -> foo end.">>},
  402:           {rec_2,
  403:            <<"t() -> receive foo -> bar after foo:bar() -> 0 end.">>},
  404:           {rec_3,
  405:            <<"t() -> receive after 1 -> ok end.">>},
  406:           {rec_4,
  407:            <<"t() -> receive {X,Y} -> {a,X,Y} end.">>},
  408:           {rec_5,
  409:            <<"t() -> receive
  410:                          {X,Y} ->
  411:                              {X,Y};
  412:                          Z ->
  413:                              Z
  414:                      after
  415:                          foo:bar() ->
  416:                              {3,4}
  417:                      end.">>}
  418:           ],
  419:     compile(Config, Ts),
  420:     ok.
  421: 
  422: bits(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  423:     Ts = [{bit_1, % copied from shell_SUITE
  424:            <<"t() -> <<(<<\"abc\">>):3/binary>>.">>},
  425:           {bit_2,
  426:            <<"t() -> <<(<<\"abc\">>)/binary>>.">>},
  427:           {bit_3,
  428:            <<"t() -> <<3.14:64/float>>.">>},
  429:           {bit_4,
  430:            <<"t() -> <<-20/signed>> = <<-20>>.">>},
  431:           {bit_5,
  432:            <<"t() -> <<-300:16/signed>> = <<-300:16>>.">>},
  433:           {bit_6,
  434:            <<"t() -> <<-(1 bsl 29):32/signed>> = <<-(1 bsl 29):32>>.">>},
  435:           {bit_7,
  436:            <<"t() -> <<A:4,B:4,C:4,D:4,E:4,F:4>> = <<\"hej\">>.">>},
  437:           {bit_8,
  438:            <<"t() -> <<>>.">>},
  439:           {bit_9,
  440:            <<"">>}
  441:           ],
  442:     compile(Config, Ts),
  443:     ok = pp_expr(<<"<<(list_to_binary([1,2]))/binary>>">>),
  444:     ok = pp_expr(
  445:           <<"<<(list_to_binary([1,2])):all/binary-unit:8-unsigned-big>>">>),
  446:     ok = pp_expr(<<"<<<<\"hej\">>/binary>>">>),
  447:     ok = pp_expr(<<"<<(foo:bar())/binary>>">>),
  448:     ok = pp_expr(<<"<<(a)/binary>>">>),
  449:     ok = pp_expr(<<"<<a/binary>>">>),
  450:     ok = pp_expr(<<"<<{a,b}/binary>>">>),
  451:     ok = pp_expr(<<"<<{foo:bar(),b}/binary>>">>),
  452:     ok = pp_expr(<<"<<(foo:bar()):(foo:bar())/binary>>">>),
  453:     ok.
  454: 
  455: head_tail(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  456:     Ts = [{list_1,
  457:            <<"t() -> [a | b].">>},
  458:           {list_2,
  459:            <<"t() -> [a,b,$\n].">>},
  460:           {list_3,
  461:            <<"t() -> [].">>},
  462:           {list_4,
  463:            <<"t() -> [a].">>},
  464:           {list_5,
  465:            <<"t() ->
  466:                [foo:bar(lkjljlskdfj, klsdajflds, sdafkljsdlfkjdas, kjlsdadjl),
  467:                bar:foo(kljlkjsdf, lkjsdlfj, [kljsfj, sdfdsfsad])].">>}
  468:           ],
  469:     compile(Config, Ts),
  470:     ok.
  471: 
  472: cond1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  473:     C = {'cond',1,[{clause,2,[],[[{tuple,2,[{atom,2,foo},{atom,2,bar}]}]],
  474:                     [{cons,3,{atom,3,a},{cons,3,{atom,3,b},{nil,3}}}]},
  475:                    {clause,4,[],[[{atom,4,true}]],
  476:                     [{tuple,5,[{atom,5,x},{atom,5,y}]}]}]},
  477:     CChars = flat_expr1(C),
  478:     "cond\n"
  479:           "    {foo, bar} ->\n"
  480:           "        [a, b];\n"
  481:           "    true ->\n"
  482:           "        {x, y}\n"
  483:           "end" = CChars,
  484:     ok.
  485: 
  486: block(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  487:     Ts = [{block_1,
  488:            <<"t() -> begin a,{c,d} end.">>}
  489:           ],
  490:     compile(Config, Ts),
  491:     ok.
  492: 
  493: case1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  494:     Ts = [{case_1,
  495:            <<"t() -> case {foo,bar} of
  496:                          {A,B} when true ->
  497:                              [A,B];
  498:                          _ ->
  499:                              foo
  500:                      end.">>}
  501:           ],
  502:     compile(Config, Ts),
  503:     ok = pp_expr(<<"case
  504:                               erl_internal:bif(M,F,length(Args))
  505:                           of
  506:                               true ->
  507:                                   call(N,Args,Prec,Hook);
  508:                               false ->
  509:                                   call(Name,Args,Prec,Hook)
  510:                           end">>),
  511:     ok.
  512: 
  513: ops(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  514:     Ts = [{ops_1,
  515:            <<"t() -> {a,b} + (3 - 2) + 4.">>},
  516:           {ops_2,
  517:            <<"t() -> a - (3 + 4).">>},
  518:           {ops_3,
  519:            <<"t() -> - (- (- (- (- 3)))).">>}
  520:           ],
  521:     compile(Config, Ts),
  522:     ok.
  523: 
  524: messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  525:     true = "{error,{some,\"error\"}}\n" =:=
  526:         lists:flatten(erl_pp:form({error,{some,"error"}})),
  527:     true = "{warning,{some,\"warning\"}}\n" =:=
  528:         lists:flatten(erl_pp:form({warning,{some,"warning"}})),
  529:     "\n" = flat_form({eof,0}),
  530:     ok.
  531: 
  532: import_export(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  533:     Ts = [{import_1,
  534:            <<"-import(lists, [max/1, reverse/1]).
  535:               -import(sofs, []).
  536:               t(L) ->
  537:                   max(reverse(L)).">>},
  538:           {export_1,
  539:            <<"-export([t/0]).
  540:               -export([]).
  541:               t() -> [].">>},
  542:           {qlc_1,
  543:            <<"-include_lib(\"stdlib/include/qlc.hrl\").
  544:               t() -> qlc:q([X || X <- []]).">>}
  545:           ],
  546:     compile(Config, Ts),
  547:     ok.
  548: 
  549: format_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  550:     "case 1 of\n"
  551:     "  2 ->\n"
  552:     "    3;\n"
  553:     "  4 ->\n"
  554:     "    5\n"
  555:     "end" = flat_parse_and_pp_expr("case 1 of 2 -> 3; 4 -> 5 end", 0, [{indent, 2}]),
  556: 
  557:     "-spec foo(bar(),\n"
  558:     "          qux()) ->\n"
  559:     "           T |\n"
  560:     "           baz(T)\n"
  561:     "           when\n"
  562:     "             T ::\n"
  563:     "               tuple().\n" =
  564: 	lists:flatten(
  565: 	    parse_and_pp_forms(
  566: 		"-spec foo(bar(), qux()) -> T | baz(T) when T :: tuple().",
  567: 		[{indent, 2}, {linewidth, 20}]
  568: 	    )
  569: 	),
  570: 
  571:     "-spec foo(bar(), qux()) -> T | baz(T) when T :: tuple().\n" =
  572: 	lists:flatten(
  573: 	    parse_and_pp_forms(
  574: 		"-spec foo(bar(), qux()) -> T | baz(T) when T :: tuple().",
  575: 		[{indent, 2}, {linewidth, 1000}]
  576: 	    )
  577: 	).
  578: 
  579: form_vars(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  580:     %% Check that erl_pp:legalize_vars/1 does its job.  If
  581:     %% legalize_vars/1 fails to convert variable names starting with a
  582:     %% lower case letter, the compiler will detect that `X` is an atom
  583:     %% and report that the `+` operation will fail. If legalize_vars/1
  584:     %% fails to generate unique variable names and just converts the
  585:     %% name to uppercase, the variable named `REC0` will be used in an
  586:     %% unsafe way.
  587:     String = <<"-module(erl_pp_test).
  588:                 -export([f/1]).
  589:                 -record(r, {a, b}).
  590:                 f(#r{b = B} = C) ->
  591:                   receive
  592: 	            B ->
  593: 	              X = C#r.a,
  594: 	              REC0 = X + X,
  595: 	              REC0
  596:                     end.">>,
  597:     FileName = filename('erl_pp_test.erl', Config),
  598:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, String),
  599:     Opts = [binary,deterministic,nowarn_unused_record],
  600:     {ok, [], Forms} = compile:file(FileName, ['E'|Opts]),
  601:     Forms1 = lists:map(fun(F={function,_,_,_,_}) ->
  602:                                erl_pp:legalize_vars(F);
  603:                           (F) ->
  604:                                F
  605:                        end, Forms),
  606:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, [erl_pp:form(F) || F <- Forms1]),
  607:     {ok, _, _, []} = compile:file(FileName, [return|Opts]),
  608:     ok.
  609: 
  610: misc_attrs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  611:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-module(m). ">>),
  612:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-module(m, [Aafjlksfjdlsjflsdfjlsdjflkdsfjlk,"
  613:                     "Blsjfdlslfjsdf]). ">>),
  614:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-export([]). ">>),
  615:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-export([foo/2, bar/0]). ">>),
  616:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-export([bar/0]). ">>),
  617:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-import(lists, []). ">>),
  618:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-import(lists, [map/2]). ">>),
  619:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-import(lists, [map/2, foreach/2]). ">>),
  620:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-'wild '({attr2,3}). ">>),
  621:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-record(a, {b,c}). ">>),
  622:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-record(' a ', {}). ">>),
  623:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-record(' a ', {foo = foo:bar()}). ">>),
  624:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-custom1(#{test1 => init/2, test2 => [val/1, val/2]}). ">>),
  625:     ok.
  626: 
  627: dialyzer_attrs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  628:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-type foo() :: #bar{}. ">>),
  629:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-opaque foo() :: {bar, fun((X, [42,...]) -> X)}. ">>),
  630:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-spec foo(bar(), qux()) -> [T | baz(T)]. ">>),
  631:     ok = pp_forms(<<"-callback foo(<<_:32,_:_*4>>, T) -> T. ">>),
  632:     ok.
  633: 
  634: hook(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  635:     F = fun(H) -> H end,
  636:     do_hook(F).
  637: 
  638: do_hook(HookFun) ->
  639:     Lc = parse_expr(binary_to_list(<<"[X || X <- [1,2,3]].">>)),
  640:     H = HookFun(fun hook/4),
  641:     A0 = erl_anno:new(0),
  642:     Expr = {call,A0,{atom,A0,fff},[{foo,Lc},{foo,Lc},{foo,Lc}]},
  643:     EChars = lists:flatten(erl_pp:expr(Expr, 0, H)),
  644:     Call = {call,A0,{atom,A0,foo},[Lc]},
  645:     Expr2 = {call,A0,{atom,A0,fff},[Call,Call,Call]},
  646:     EChars2 = erl_pp:exprs([Expr2]),
  647:     true = EChars =:= lists:flatten(EChars2),
  648: 
  649:     EsChars = erl_pp:exprs([Expr], H),
  650:     true = EChars =:= lists:flatten(EsChars),
  651: 
  652:     A1 = erl_anno:new(1),
  653:     F = {function,A1,ffff,0,[{clause,A1,[],[],[Expr]}]},
  654:     FuncChars = lists:flatten(erl_pp:function(F, H)),
  655:     F2 = {function,A1,ffff,0,[{clause,A1,[],[],[Expr2]}]},
  656:     FuncChars2 = erl_pp:function(F2),
  657:     true = FuncChars =:= lists:flatten(FuncChars2),
  658:     FFormChars = erl_pp:form(F, H),
  659:     true = FuncChars =:= lists:flatten(FFormChars),
  660: 
  661:     A = {attribute,A1,record,{r,[{record_field,A1,{atom,A1,a},Expr}]}},
  662:     AChars = lists:flatten(erl_pp:attribute(A, H)),
  663:     A2 = {attribute,A1,record,{r,[{record_field,A1,{atom,A1,a},Expr2}]}},
  664:     AChars2 = erl_pp:attribute(A2),
  665:     true = AChars =:= lists:flatten(AChars2),
  666:     AFormChars = erl_pp:form(A, H),
  667:     true = AChars =:= lists:flatten(AFormChars),
  668: 
  669:     "INVALID-FORM:{foo,bar}:" = lists:flatten(erl_pp:expr({foo,bar})),
  670: 
  671:     %% A list (as before R6), not a list of lists.
  672:     G = [{op,A1,'>',{atom,A1,a},{foo,{atom,A1,b}}}], % not a proper guard
  673:     GChars = lists:flatten(erl_pp:guard(G, H)),
  674:     G2 = [{op,A1,'>',{atom,A1,a},
  675:            {call,A0,{atom,A0,foo},[{atom,A1,b}]}}], % not a proper guard
  676:     GChars2 = erl_pp:guard(G2),
  677:     true = GChars =:= lists:flatten(GChars2),
  678: 
  679:     EH = HookFun({?MODULE, ehook, [foo,bar]}),
  680:     XEChars = erl_pp:expr(Expr, -1, EH),
  681:     true = remove_indentation(EChars) =:= lists:flatten(XEChars),
  682:     XEChars2 = erl_pp:expr(Expr, EH),
  683:     true = EChars =:= lists:flatten(XEChars2),
  684: 
  685:     %% Note: no leading spaces before "begin".
  686:     Block = {block,A0,[{match,A0,{var,A0,'A'},{integer,A0,3}},
  687:                       {atom,A0,true}]},
  688:     "begin\n                     A =" ++ _ =
  689:                lists:flatten(erl_pp:expr(Block, 17, none)),
  690: 
  691:     %% Special...
  692:     true =
  693:         "{some,value}" =:= lists:flatten(erl_pp:expr({value,A0,{some,value}})),
  694: 
  695:     %% More compatibility: before R6
  696:     OldIf = {'if',A0,[{clause,A0,[],[{atom,A0,true}],[{atom,A0,b}]}]},
  697:     NewIf = {'if',A0,[{clause,A0,[],[[{atom,A0,true}]],[{atom,A0,b}]}]},
  698:     OldIfChars = lists:flatten(erl_pp:expr(OldIf)),
  699:     NewIfChars = lists:flatten(erl_pp:expr(NewIf)),
  700:     true = OldIfChars =:= NewIfChars,
  701: 
  702:     ok.
  703: 
  704: remove_indentation(S) ->
  705:     %% T is for the very special leaf(" ") used for lc and bc.
  706:     T = re:replace(S, " \n *", "", [{return,list},global]),
  707:     re:replace(T, "\n *", " ", [{return,list},global]).
  708: 
  709: ehook(HE, I, P, H, foo, bar) ->
  710:     hook(HE, I, P, H).
  711: 
  712: hook({foo,E}, I, P, H) ->
  713:     A = erl_anno:new(0),
  714:     erl_pp:expr({call,A,{atom,A,foo},[E]}, I, P, H).
  715: 
  716: neg_indent(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  717:     ok = pp_expr(<<"begin a end">>),
  718:     ok = pp_expr(<<"begin a,b end">>),
  719:     ok = pp_expr(<<"try a,b,c
  720:                               catch exit:_ -> d;
  721:                                     throw:_ -> t;
  722:                                     error:{foo,bar} -> foo,
  723:                                                        bar
  724:                               end">>),
  725:     ok = pp_expr(
  726:             <<"fun() ->
  727:                   F = fun(A, B) when ((A#r1.a) orelse (B#r2.a))
  728:                                      or (B#r2.b) or (A#r1.b) ->
  729:                             true;
  730:                          (_, _) -> false
  731:                       end,
  732:                   true = F(#r1{a = false, b = false},
  733:                            #r2{a = false, b = true}),
  734:                   false = F(#r1{a = true, b = true},
  735:                             #r1{a = false, b = true}),
  736:                   ok
  737:                        end()">>),
  738: 
  739:     ok = pp_expr(<<"[X || X <- a, true]">>),
  740:     ok = pp_expr(<<"{[a,b,c],[d,e|f]}">>),
  741:     ok = pp_expr(<<"f(a,b,c)">>),
  742:     ok = pp_expr(<<"fun() when a,b;c,d -> a end">>),
  743:     ok = pp_expr(<<"fun A() when a,b;c,d -> a end">>),
  744:     ok = pp_expr(<<"<<34:32,17:32>>">>),
  745:     ok = pp_expr(<<"if a,b,c -> d; e,f,g -> h,i end">>),
  746:     ok = pp_expr(<<"if a -> d; c -> d end">>),
  747:     ok = pp_expr(<<"receive after 1 -> 2 end">>),
  748:     ok = pp_expr(<<"begin a,b,c end">>),
  749: 
  750:     "\"\"" = flat_expr({string,0,""}),
  751:     ok = pp_expr(<<"\"abc\"">>),
  752:     ok = pp_expr(<<"\"abc\n\n\n\n\nkjsd\n\n\n\n\nkljsddf\n\n\n\n\n"
  753: 		   "klafd\n\n\n\n\nkljsdf\n\n\n\n\nsdf\n\n\n\n\n\"">>),
  754:     ok = pp_expr(<<"fkjlskljklkkljlkjlkjkljlkjsljklf"
  755: 		   "lsdjlfdsjlfjsdlfjdslfjdlsjfsdjfklsdkfjsdf("
  756: 		   "\"abc\n\n\n\n\nkjsd\n\n\n\n\nkljsddf\n\n\n\n\n"
  757: 		   "kljsafd\n\n\n\n\nkljsdf\n\n\n\n\nkjsdf"
  758: 		   "\n\n\n\n\n\")">>),
  759: 
  760:     %% fun-info is skipped when everything is to fit on one single line
  761:     Fun1 = {'fun',1,{function,t,0},{0,45353021,'-t/0-fun-0-'}},
  762:     "fun t/0" = flat_expr(Fun1),
  763:     Fun2 = {'fun',2,{clauses,[{clause,2,[],[],[{atom,3,true}]}]},
  764:             {0,108059557,'-t/0-fun-0-'}},
  765:     "fun() -> true end" = flat_expr(Fun2),
  766:     Fun3 = {named_fun,3,'True',[{clause,3,[],[],[{atom,3,true}]}],
  767:             {0,424242424,'-t/0-True-0-'}},
  768:     "fun True() -> true end" = flat_expr(Fun3),
  769: 
  770:     ok.
  771: 
  772: 
  773: %% OTP_6321. Bug fix of exprs().
  774: otp_6321(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  775:     Str = "S = hopp, {hej, S}. ",
  776:     {done, {ok, Tokens, _EndLine}, ""} = erl_scan:tokens("", Str, _L=1),
  777:     {ok, Exprs} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
  778:     "S = hopp, {hej, S}" = lists:flatten(erl_pp:exprs(Exprs)),
  779:     ok.
  780: 
  781: %% OTP_6911. More newlines.
  782: otp_6911(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  783:     F = {function,5,thomas,1,
  784:          [{clause,5,
  785:            [{var,5,'X'}],
  786:            [],
  787:            [{'case',6,
  788:              {var,6,'X'},
  789:              [{clause,7,[{atom,7,true}],[],[{integer,7,12}]},
  790:               {clause,8,[{atom,8,false}],[],[{integer,8,14}]}]}]}]},
  791:     Chars = flat_form(F),
  792:     "thomas(X) ->\n"
  793:           "    case X of\n"
  794:           "        true ->\n"
  795:           "            12;\n"
  796:           "        false ->\n"
  797:           "            14\n"
  798:           "    end.\n" = Chars,
  799:     ok = pp_expr(<<"case X of true -> 12; false -> 14 end">>),
  800:     ok = pp_expr(<<"receive after 1 -> ok end">>),
  801:     ok.
  802: 
  803: %% OTP_6914. Binary comprehensions.
  804: otp_6914(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  805:     ok = pp_expr(<<"<< <<B:1>> || B <- [0,1,1] >>">>),
  806:     ok = pp_expr(<<"[ B || <<B:1>> <= <<\"hi\">>]">>),
  807:     ok = pp_expr(<<"<< <<1:1>> || true >>">>),
  808:     ok.

  810: %% OTP_8150. Types.
  811: otp_8150(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  812:     _ = [{N,ok} = {N,pp_forms(B)} ||
  813:                   {N,B} <- type_examples()
  814:                      ],
  815:     ok.
  816: 
  817: %% OTP_8238. Bugfix 'E'.
  818: otp_8238(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  819:     Ex = [<<"-record(rec1, {}).\n"
  820:             "-record(rec2, {a, b}).\n"
  821:             "-record(rec3, {f123, g, h}).\n">>,
  822:           <<"-type line() :: integer().\n">>,
  823:           <<"-type info_line() :: integer() | term().\n">>,
  824:           <<"-type column() :: pos_integer().\n">>,
  825:           [["\n", B] || {_,B} <- type_examples()],
  826:           <<"t1(T) ->\n"
  827:             "    foo:bar(#rec1{}, #rec2{}),\n"
  828:             "    T.\n"
  829:             "t2() ->\n"
  830:             "    #r{}.\n">>
  831:          ],
  832:     compile(Config, [{otp_8238,iolist_to_binary(Ex)}]),
  833:     ok.
  834: 
  835: type_examples() ->
  836:     [{ex1,<<"-type ann() :: Var :: integer(). ">>},
  837:      {ex2,<<"-type ann2() :: Var :: "
  838:             "'return' | 'return_white_spaces' | 'return_comments'"
  839:             " | 'text' | ann(). ">>},
  840:      {ex3,<<"-type paren() :: (ann2()). ">>},
  841:      {ex4,<<"-type t1() :: atom(). ">>},
  842:      {ex5,<<"-type t2() :: [t1()]. ">>},
  843:      {ex56,<<"-type integer(A) :: A. ">>},
  844:      {ex6,<<"-type t3(Atom) :: integer(Atom). ">>},
  845:      {ex7,<<"-type '\\'t::4'() :: t3('\\'foobar'). ">>},
  846:      {ex8,<<"-type t5() :: {t1(), t3(foo)}. ">>},
  847:      {ex9,<<"-type t6() :: 1 | 2 | 3 | 'foo' | 'bar'. ">>},
  848:      {ex10,<<"-type t7() :: []. ">>},
  849:      {ex11,<<"-type t71() :: [_]. ">>},
  850:      {ex12,<<"-type t8() :: {any(),none(),pid(),port(),"
  851:        "reference(),float()}. ">>},
  852:      {ex13,<<"-type t9() :: [1|2|3|foo|bar] | "
  853:        "list(a | b | c) | t71(). ">>},
  854:      {ex14,<<"-type t10() :: {1|2|3|foo|t9()} | {}. ">>},
  855:      {ex15,<<"-type t11() :: 1..2. ">>},
  856:      {ex16,<<"-type t13() :: maybe_improper_list(integer(), t11()). ">>},
  857:      {ex17,<<"-type t14() :: [erl_scan:foo() | "
  858:        "erl_scan:bar(34, 92) | t13() | m:f(integer() | <<_:_*16>>)]. ">>},
  859:      {ex18,<<"-type t15() :: {binary(),<<>>,<<_:34>>,<<_:_*42>>,"
  860:        "<<_:3,_:_*14>>,<<>>} | [<<>>|<<_:34>>|<<_:16>>|"
  861:        "<<_:3,_:_*1472>>|<<_:19,_:_*14>>| <<_:34>>|"
  862:        "<<_:34>>|<<_:34>>|<<_:34>>]. ">>},
  863:      {ex19,<<"-type t16() :: fun(). ">>},
  864:      {ex20,<<"-type t17() :: fun((...) -> paren()). ">>},
  865:      {ex21,<<"-type t18() :: fun(() -> t17() | t16()). ">>},
  866:      {ex22,<<"-type t19() :: fun((t18()) -> t16()) |"
  867:        "fun((nonempty_maybe_improper_list('integer', any())|"
  868:        "1|2|3|a|b|<<_:3,_:_*14>>|integer()) ->"
  869:        "nonempty_maybe_improper_list('integer', any())|"
  870:        "1|2|3|a|b|<<_:3,_:_*14>>|integer()). ">>},
  871:      {ex23,<<"-type t20() :: [t19(), ...]. ">>},
  872:      {ex24,<<"-type t21() :: tuple(). ">>},
  873:      {ex25,<<"-type t21(A) :: A. ">>},
  874:      {ex26,<<"-type t22() :: t21(integer()). ">>},
  875:      {ex27,<<"-type t23() :: #rec1{}. ">>},
  876:      {ex28,<<"-type t24() :: #rec2{a :: t23(), b :: [atom()]}. ">>},
  877:      {ex29,<<"-type t25() :: #rec3{f123 :: [t24() | "
  878:        "1|2|3|4|a|b|c|d| "
  879:        "nonempty_maybe_improper_list(integer, any())]}. ">>},
  880:      {ex30,<<"-type t99() ::"
  881:        "{t2(),'\\'t::4'(),t5(),t6(),t7(),t8(),t10(),t14(),"
  882:        "t15(),t20(),t21(), t22(),t25()}. ">>},
  883:      %% Writing constraints as is_subtype(V, T) is not supported since
  884:      %% Erlang/OTP 19.0, but as long as the parser recognizes the
  885:      %% is_subtype(V, T) syntax, we need a few examples of the syntax.
  886:      {ex31,<<"-spec t1(FooBar :: t99()) -> t99();"
  887: 	     "(t2()) -> t2();"
  888: 	     "('\\'t::4'()) -> {'\\'t::4'(), B}"
  889:              "             when is_subtype(B, '\\'t::4'());"
  890: 	     "(t23()) -> C when is_subtype(C, atom()),"
  891: 	     "                      is_subtype(C, t14());"
  892: 	     "(t24()) -> D when is_subtype(D, atom()),"
  893: 	     "                      is_subtype(D, t14()),"
  894: 	     "                      is_subtype(D, '\\'t::4'()).">>},
  895:      {ex32,<<"-spec erl_pp_test:t2() -> any(). ">>},
  896:      {ex33,<<"-opaque attributes_data() :: "
  897:        "[{'column', column()} | {'line', info_line()} |"
  898:        " {'text', string()}] |  {line(),column()}. ">>},
  899:      {ex34,<<"-record(r,{"
  900:        "f1 :: attributes_data(),"
  901:            "f222 = foo:bar(34, #rec3{}, 234234234423, "
  902:            "               aassdsfsdfsdf, 2234242323) :: "
  903:            "               [t24() | 1|2|3|4|a|b|c|d| "
  904:            "     nonempty_maybe_improper_list(integer, any())],"
  905:            "f333 :: [t24() | 1|2|3|4|a|b|c|d| "
  906:            "    nonempty_maybe_improper_list(integer, any())],"
  907:            "f3 = x:y(),"
  908:            "f4 = x:z() :: t99(),"
  909:            "f17 :: 'undefined',"
  910:            "f18 :: 1 | 2 | 'undefined',"
  911:            "f19 = 3 :: integer()|undefined,"
  912:            "f5 = 3 :: undefined|integer()}). ">>}].
  913: 
  914: %% OTP_8473. Bugfix abstract type 'fun'.
  915: otp_8473(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  916:     Ex = [{ex1,<<"-type 'fun'(A) :: A.\n"
  917:                  "-type funkar() :: 'fun'(fun((integer()) -> atom())).\n">>}],
  918:     _ = [{N,ok} = {N,pp_forms(B)} ||
  919:                   {N,B} <- Ex],
  920:     ok.
  921: 
  922: %% OTP_8522. Avoid duplicated 'undefined' in record field types.
  923: otp_8522(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  924:     FileName = filename('otp_8522.erl', Config),
  925:     C = <<"-module(otp_8522).\n"
  926:           "-record(r, {f1 :: undefined,\n"
  927:           "            f2 :: A :: undefined,\n"
  928:           "            f3 :: (undefined),\n"
  929:           "            f4 :: x | y | undefined | z,\n"
  930:           "            f5 :: a}).\n">>,
  931:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, C),
  932:     {ok, _} = compile:file(FileName, [{outdir,?privdir},debug_info]),
  933:     BF = filename("otp_8522", Config),
  934:     {ok, A} = beam_lib:chunks(BF, [abstract_code]),
  935:     %% OTP-12719: Since 'undefined' is no longer added by the Erlang
  936:     %% Parser, the number of 'undefined' is 4. It used to be 5.
  937:     4 = count_atom(A, undefined),
  938:     ok.
  939: 
  940: count_atom(A, A) ->
  941:     1;
  942: count_atom(T, A) when is_tuple(T) ->
  943:     count_atom(tuple_to_list(T), A);
  944: count_atom(L, A) when is_list(L) ->
  945:     lists:sum([count_atom(T, A) || T <- L]);
  946: count_atom(_, _) ->
  947:     0.
  948: 
  949: maps_syntax(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  950:     Ts = [{map_fun_1,
  951:             <<"t() ->\n"
  952:               "    M0 = #{ 1 => hi, hi => 42, 1.0 => {hi,world}},\n"
  953:               "    M1 = M0#{ 1 := hello, new_val => 1337 },\n"
  954:               "    map_fun_2:val(M1).\n">>},
  955:           {map_fun_2,
  956:             <<"val(#{ 1 := V1, hi := V2, new_val := V3}) -> {V1,V2,V3}.\n">>}],
  957:     compile(Config, Ts),
  958: 
  959:     ok = pp_expr(<<"#{}">>),
  960:     ok = pp_expr(<<"#{ a => 1, <<\"hi\">> => \"world\", 33 => 1.0 }">>),
  961:     ok = pp_expr(<<"#{ a := V1, <<\"hi\">> := V2 } = M">>),
  962:     ok = pp_expr(<<"M#{ a => V1, <<\"hi\">> := V2 }">>),
  963:     F = <<"-module(maps_type_syntax).\n"
  964:           "-compile(export_all).\n"
  965:           "-type t1() :: map().\n"
  966:           "-type t2() :: #{ atom() => integer(), atom() => float() }.\n"
  967:           "-type t3() :: #{ atom() := integer(), atom() := float() }.\n"
  968:           "-type u() :: #{a => (I :: integer()) | (A :: atom()),\n"
  969:           "               (X :: atom()) | (Y :: atom()) =>\n"
  970:           "                   (I :: integer()) | (A :: atom())}.\n"
  971:           "-spec f1(t1()) -> 'true'.\n"
  972:           "f1(M) when is_map(M) -> true.\n"
  973:           "-spec f2(t2()) -> integer().\n"
  974:           "f2(#{a := V1,b := V2}) -> V1 + V2.\n"
  975:           "\n">>,
  976:     ok = pp_forms(F),
  977:     ok.
  978: 
  979: quoted_atom_types(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  980:     Q = [{quote_singleton_atom_types, true}],
  981:     U = [{encoding,unicode}],
  982:     L = [{encoding,latin1}],
  983:     F = "-type t() :: a | a().",
  984:     "-type t() :: 'a' | a().\n" =
  985:         lists:flatten(parse_and_pp_forms(F, Q ++ L)),
  986:     "-type t() :: 'a' | a().\n" =
  987:         lists:flatten(parse_and_pp_forms(F, Q ++ U)),
  988:     UF = "-type t() :: '\x{400}' | '\x{400}'().",
  989:     "-type t() :: '\\x{400}' | '\\x{400}'().\n" =
  990:         lists:flatten(parse_and_pp_forms(UF, Q ++ L)),
  991:     "-type t() :: '\x{400}' | '\x{400}'().\n" =
  992:         lists:flatten(parse_and_pp_forms(UF, Q ++ U)),
  993:     ok.

 1032:     FileName = filename('otp_8664.erl', Config),

 1034:            "-export([t/0]).\n"
 1035:            "-define(A, -3).\n"
 1036:            "-define(B, (?A*(-1 band (((2)))))).\n"
 1037:            "-type t1() :: ?B | ?A.\n"
 1038:            "-type t2() :: ?B-1 .. -?B.\n"
 1039:            "-type t3() :: 9 band (8 - 3) | 1+2 | 5 band 3.\n"
 1040:            "-type b1() :: <<_:_*(3-(-1))>>\n"
 1041:            "            | <<_:(-(?B))>>\n"
 1042:            "            | <<_:4>>.\n"
 1043:            "-type u() :: 1 .. 2 | 3.. 4 | (8-3) ..6 | 5+0..6.\n"
 1044:            "-type t() :: t1() | t2() | t3() | b1() | u().\n"
 1045:            "-spec t() -> t().\n"
 1046:            "t() -> 3.\n">>,
 1047:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, C1),
 1048:     {ok, _, []} = compile:file(FileName, [return]),
 1049: 
 1050:     C2 = <<"-module(otp_8664).\n"
 1051:            "-export([t/0]).\n"
 1052:            "-spec t() -> 9 and 4.\n"
 1053:            "t() -> 0.\n">>,
 1054:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, C2),
 1055:     {error,[{_,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{type_syntax,integer}}]}],_} =
 1056:         compile:file(FileName, [return]),
 1057: 
 1058:     ok.

 1060: %% OTP-9147. Create well-formed types when adding 'undefined'.
 1061: otp_9147(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1062:     FileName = filename('otp_9147.erl', Config),
 1063:     C1 = <<"-module(otp_9147).\n"
 1064:            "-export_type([undef/0]).\n"
 1065:            "-record(undef, {f1 :: F1 :: a | b}).\n"
 1066:            "-type undef() :: #undef{}.\n">>,
 1067:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, C1),
 1068:     {ok, _, []} =
 1069:        compile:file(FileName, [return,'P',{outdir,?privdir}]),
 1070:     PFileName = filename('otp_9147.P', Config),
 1071:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(PFileName),
 1072:     %% The parentheses around "F1 :: a | b" are new (bugfix).
 1073:     true =
 1074:         lists:member("-record(undef,{f1 :: F1 :: a | b}).",
 1075:                      string:tokens(binary_to_list(Bin), "\n")),
 1076:     ok.

 1078: %% OTP-10302. Unicode characters scanner/parser.
 1079: otp_10302(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1080:     Ts = [{uni_1,
 1081:            <<"t() -> <<(<<\"abc\\x{aaa}\">>):3/binary>>.">>}
 1082:           ],
 1083:     compile(Config, Ts),
 1084:     ok = pp_expr(<<"$\\x{aaa}">>),
 1085:     ok = pp_expr(<<"\"1\\x{aaa}\"">>),
 1086:     ok = pp_expr(<<"<<<<\"hej\">>/binary>>">>),
 1087:     ok = pp_expr(<<"<< <<\"1\\x{aaa}\">>/binary>>">>),
 1088: 
 1089:     U = [{encoding,unicode}],
 1090: 
 1091:     do_hook(fun(H) -> [{hook,H}] end),
 1092:     do_hook(fun(H) -> [{hook,H}]++U end),
 1093: 
 1094:     ok = pp_expr(<<"$\\x{aaa}">>, [{hook,fun hook/4}]),
 1095: 
 1096:     Opts = [{hook, fun unicode_hook/4},{encoding,unicode}],
 1097:     Lc = parse_expr("[X || X <- [\"\x{400}\",\"\xFF\"]]."),
 1098:     A0 = erl_anno:new(0),
 1099:     Expr = {call,A0,{atom,A0,fff},[{foo,{foo,Lc}},{foo,{foo,Lc}}]},
 1100:     EChars = lists:flatten(erl_pp:expr(Expr, 0, Opts)),
 1101:     Call = {call,A0,{atom,A0,foo},[{call,A0,{atom,A0,foo},[Lc]}]},
 1102:     Expr2 = {call,A0,{atom,A0,fff},[Call,Call]},
 1103:     EChars2 = erl_pp:exprs([Expr2], U),
 1104:     EChars = lists:flatten(EChars2),
 1105:     [$\x{400},$\x{400}] = [C || C <- EChars, C > 255],
 1106: 
 1107:     ok = pp_forms(<<"function() -> {\"\x{400}\",$\x{400}}. "/utf8>>, U),
 1108:     ok = pp_forms("function() -> {\"\x{400}\",$\x{400}}. ", []),
 1109:     ok.
 1110: 
 1111: unicode_hook({foo,E}, I, P, H) ->
 1112:     A = erl_anno:new(0),
 1113:     erl_pp:expr({call,A,{atom,A,foo},[E]}, I, P, H).
 1114:

 1117:     C1 = <<"%% coding: utf-8\n -module(any).">>,
 1118:     ok = do_otp_10820(Config, C1, ["+pc", "latin1"]),
 1119:     ok = do_otp_10820(Config, C1, ["+pc", "unicode"]),
 1120:     C2 = <<"%% coding: latin-1\n -module(any).">>,
 1121:     ok = do_otp_10820(Config, C2, ["+pc", "latin1"]),
 1122:     ok = do_otp_10820(Config, C2, ["+pc", "unicode"]).
 1123: 
 1124: do_otp_10820(Config, C, PC) ->
 1125:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+fnu"] ++ PC),
 1126:     L = [915,953,959,973,957,953,954,959,957,964],
 1127:     FileName = filename(L++".erl", Config),
 1128:     ok = rpc:call(Node, file, write_file, [FileName, C]),
 1129:     {ok, _, []} =  rpc:call(Node, compile, file,
 1130:                             [FileName, [return,'P',{outdir,?privdir}]]),
 1131:     PFileName = filename(L++".P", Config),
 1132:     {ok, Bin} = rpc:call(Node, file, read_file, [PFileName]),
 1133:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1134:     true = file_attr_is_string(binary_to_list(Bin)),
 1135:     ok.
 1136: 
 1137: file_attr_is_string("-file(\"" ++ _) -> true;
 1138: file_attr_is_string([_ | L]) ->
 1139:     file_attr_is_string(L).

 1142: otp_11100(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1143:     %% There are a few places where the added code ("options(none)")
 1144:     %% doesn't make a difference (pp:bit_elem_type/1 is an example).
 1145: 
 1146:     A1 = erl_anno:new(1),
 1147:     "-type foo() :: integer(INVALID-FORM:{foo,bar}:).\n" =
 1148:         pf({attribute,A1,type,{foo,{type,A1,integer,[{foo,bar}]},[]}}),
 1149:     pf({attribute,A1,type,
 1150:         {a,{type,A1,range,[{integer,A1,1},{foo,bar}]},[]}}),
 1151:     "-type foo(INVALID-FORM:{foo,bar}:) :: A.\n" =
 1152:         pf({attribute,A1,type,{foo,{var,A1,'A'},[{foo,bar}]}}),
 1153:     "-type foo() :: INVALID-FORM:{foo,bar}: :: [].\n" =
 1154:         pf({attribute,A1,type,
 1155:             {foo,{paren_type,A1,
 1156:                   [{ann_type,A1,[{foo,bar},{type,A1,nil,[]}]}]},
 1157:              []}}),
 1158:     "-type foo() :: <<_:INVALID-FORM:{foo,bar}:>>.\n" =
 1159:         pf({attribute,A1,type,
 1160:             {foo,{type,A1,binary,[{foo,bar},{integer,A1,0}]},[]}}),
 1161:     "-type foo() :: <<_:10, _:_*INVALID-FORM:{foo,bar}:>>.\n" =
 1162:         pf({attribute,A1,type,
 1163:             {foo,{type,A1,binary,[{integer,A1,10},{foo,bar}]},[]}}),
 1164:     "-type foo() :: #r{INVALID-FORM:{foo,bar}: :: integer()}.\n" =
 1165:         pf({attribute,A1,type,
 1166:             {foo,{type,A1,record,
 1167:                   [{atom,A1,r},

 1254: otp_15751(_Config) ->
 1255:     Check = fun(L) ->
 1256:                     ok = pp_expr(L),
 1257:                     remove_indentation(flat_parse_and_pp_expr(L, 0, []))
 1258:             end,
 1259:     "try foo:bar() catch Reason:Stacktrace -> {Reason, Stacktrace} end" =
 1260:         Check("try foo:bar()
 1261:            catch Reason:Stacktrace -> {Reason, Stacktrace}  end"),
 1262: 
 1263:     "try foo:bar() catch throw:Reason:Stacktrace -> {Reason, Stacktrace} end" =
 1264:         Check("try foo:bar()
 1265:            catch throw:Reason:Stacktrace -> {Reason, Stacktrace} end"),
 1266: 
 1267:     "try foo:bar() catch Reason:_ -> Reason end" =
 1268:         Check("try foo:bar()
 1269:            catch Reason:_ -> Reason end"),
 1270: 
 1271:     "try foo:bar() catch throw:Reason -> Reason end" = % ":_" removed
 1272:         Check("try foo:bar()
 1273:            catch throw:Reason:_-> Reason end"),
 1274: 
 1275:     "try foo:bar() catch throw:Reason -> Reason end" = % "throw:" added
 1276:         Check("try foo:bar()
 1277:            catch Reason -> Reason end"),
 1278: 
 1279:     "try foo:bar() catch throw:Reason -> Reason end" =
 1280:         Check("try foo:bar()
 1281:            catch throw:Reason -> Reason end"),
 1282: 
 1283:     ok.

 1325: otp_16435(_Config) ->
 1326:     CheckF = fun(S) -> S = lists:flatten(parse_and_pp_forms(S, [])) end,
 1327:     CheckF("-type t() :: A :: integer().\n"),
 1328:     CheckF("-type t() :: A :: (B :: integer()).\n"),
 1329:     CheckF("-type t() :: {A :: (B :: integer())}.\n"),
 1330:     CheckF("-record(r,{f :: {A :: (B :: integer())}}).\n"),
 1331:     CheckF("-record(r,{f = 3 :: {A :: (B :: integer())}}).\n"),
 1332:     CheckF("-type t() :: #r{f :: A :: (B :: integer())}.\n"),
 1333:     CheckF("-spec t(X) -> X when X :: Y :: (Z :: #r{}).\n"),
 1334: 
 1335:     CheckF("f() ->\n    << \n      (catch <<1:4>>) ||\n"
 1336:            "          A <- []\n    >>.\n"),
 1337:     CheckF("f() ->\n    [ \n     catch foo ||\n         A <- []\n    ].\n"),
 1338:     CheckF("f() ->\n    1 = catch 1.\n"),
 1339:     CheckF("f() ->\n    catch 1 = catch 1.\n"),
 1340:     CheckF("f() ->\n    A = catch 1 / 0.\n"),
 1341:     CheckF("f() when erlang:float(3.0) ->\n    true.\n"),
 1342:     CheckF("f() ->\n    (catch 16)#{}.\n"),
 1343: 
 1344:     Check = fun(S) -> S = flat_parse_and_pp_expr(S, 0, []) end,
 1345:     Check("5 #r4.f1"),
 1346:     Check("17 #{[] => true}"),
 1347:     Check("0 #r1{f2 = foo}"),
 1348:     Check("fun foo:bar/17 #{}"),
 1349:     Check("fun a/2 #{}"),
 1350: 
 1351:     Check("try foo:bar() of\n"
 1352:           "    a ->\n"
 1353:           "        b\n"
 1354:           "after\n"
 1355:           "    d\n"
 1356:           "end"),
 1357: 
 1358:     Check("try foo:bar() of\n"
 1359:           "    a ->\n"
 1360:           "        b\n"
 1361:           "catch\n"
 1362:           "    _:_ ->\n"
 1363:           "        c\n"
 1364:           "end"),
 1365: 
 1366:     ok.
 1367: 
 1368: gh_5093(_Config) ->
 1369:   assert_same("f() ->\n    -1.\n"),
 1370:   assert_same("f() ->\n    +1.\n"),
 1371:   assert_same("f() ->\n    +1.1.\n"),
 1372:   assert_same("f() ->\n    +(+1).\n"),
 1373:   assert_same("f(X) ->\n    -X.\n"),
 1374:   assert_same("f(X) ->\n    +X.\n"),
 1375:   assert_same("f(X, Y) ->\n    X + Y.\n"),
 1376:   assert_same("f(X, Y) ->\n    X + +Y.\n"),
 1377:   assert_same("f(X, Y) ->\n    X - Y.\n"),
 1378:   ok.
 1379: 
 1380: eep49(_Config) ->
 1381:     assert_same("f() ->\n"
 1382:                 "    maybe ok ?= ok end.\n"),
 1383:     assert_same("f() ->\n"
 1384:                 "    maybe\n"
 1385:                 "        ok ?= ok\n"
 1386:                 "    else\n"
 1387:                 "        {error, _} ->\n"
 1388:                 "            error\n"
 1389:                 "    end.\n"),
 1390:     ok.
 1391: 
 1392: eep58(_Config) ->
 1393:     assert_same("lc_map(Map) ->\n"
 1394:                 "    [ \n"
 1395:                 "     {K, V} ||\n"
 1396:                 "         K := V <- Map\n"
 1397:                 "    ].\n"),
 1398: 
 1399:     assert_same("bc_map(Map) ->\n"
 1400:                 "    << \n"
 1401:                 "      <<K:32,V:32>> ||\n"
 1402:                 "          K := V <- Map\n"
 1403:                 "    >>.\n"),
 1404: 
 1405:     assert_same("mc(Map) ->\n"
 1406:                 "    #{ \n"
 1407:                 "      K => V + 1 ||\n"
 1408:                 "          K := V <- Map\n"
 1409:                 "    }.\n"),
 1410: 
 1411:     ok.
 1412: 
 1413: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1414: 
 1415: compile(Config, Tests) ->
 1416:     F = fun({N,P}, BadL) ->
 1417:                 case catch compile_file(Config, P) of
 1418:                     ok ->
 1419:                         case pp_forms(P) of
 1420:                             ok ->
 1421:                                 BadL;
 1422:                             not_ok ->
 1423:                                 io:format("~nTest ~p failed.~n", [N]),
 1424:                                 fail()
 1425:                         end;
 1426:                     Bad ->
 1427:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. got~n  ~p~n",
 1428:                                   [N, Bad]),
 1429:                         fail()
 1430:                 end
 1431:         end,
 1432:     lists:foldl(F, [], Tests).
 1433: 
 1434: compile_file(Config, Test0) ->
 1435:     Test = ["-module(erl_pp_test).\n",
 1436: 	    "-compile(export_all).\n",
 1437: 	    Test0],
 1438:     case compile_file(Config, Test, ['E']) of
 1439:         {ok, RootFile} ->
 1440:             File = RootFile ++ ".E",
 1441:             {ok, Bin0} = file:read_file(File),
 1442:             %% A very simple check: just try to compile the output.
 1443:             case compile_file(Config, Bin0, []) of
 1444:                 {ok, RootFile2} ->
 1445:                     File2 = RootFile2 ++ ".E",
 1446:                     {ok, Bin1} = file:read_file(File2),
 1447:                     case Bin0 =:= Bin1 of
 1448:                         true ->
 1449:                             test_max_line(binary_to_list(Bin0));
 1450:                         false ->
 1451:                             {error, file_contents_modified, {Bin0, Bin1}}
 1452:                     end;
 1453:                 Error ->
 1454:                     {error, could_not_compile_E_file, Error}
 1455:             end;
 1456:         Error ->
 1457:             Error
 1458:     end.
 1459: 
 1460: compile_file(Config, Test, Opts0) ->
 1461:     FileName = filename('erl_pp_test.erl', Config),
 1462:     Opts = [export_all,return,nowarn_unused_record,{outdir,?privdir} | Opts0],
 1463:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, Test),
 1464:     case compile:file(FileName, Opts) of
 1465:         {ok, _M, _Ws} ->
 1466:             {ok, filename:rootname(FileName)};
 1467:         Error -> Error
 1468:     end.
 1469: 
 1470: flat_expr1(Expr0) ->
 1471:     Expr = erl_parse:new_anno(Expr0),
 1472:     lists:flatten(erl_pp:expr(Expr)).
 1473: 
 1474: flat_expr(Expr0) ->
 1475:     Expr = erl_parse:new_anno(Expr0),
 1476:     lists:flatten(erl_pp:expr(Expr, -1, none)).
 1477: 
 1478: flat_form(Form0) ->
 1479:     Form = erl_parse:new_anno(Form0),
 1480:     lists:flatten(erl_pp:form(Form)).
 1481: 
 1482: pp_forms(Bin) ->
 1483:     pp_forms(Bin, none).
 1484: 
 1485: pp_forms(Bin, Options) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 1486:     pp_forms(to_list(Bin, Options), Options);
 1487: pp_forms(List, Options) when is_list(List) ->
 1488:     PP1 = (catch parse_and_pp_forms(List, Options)),
 1489:     PP2 = (catch parse_and_pp_forms(PP1, Options)),
 1490:     case PP1 =:= PP2 of % same line numbers
 1491:         true ->
 1492:             test_max_line(PP1);
 1493:         false ->
 1494:             not_ok
 1495:     end.
 1496: 
 1497: parse_and_pp_forms(String, Options) ->
 1498:     lists:append(lists:map(fun(AF) -> erl_pp:form(AF, Options)
 1499:                            end, parse_forms(String))).
 1500: 
 1501: parse_forms(Chars) ->
 1502:     String = lists:flatten(Chars),
 1503:     parse_forms2(String, [], 1, []).
 1504: 
 1505: parse_forms2([], _Cont, _Line, Forms) ->
 1506:     lists:reverse(Forms);
 1507: parse_forms2(String, Cont0, Line, Forms) ->
 1508:     %% FIXME: When the experimental features EEP has been implemented, we should
 1509:     %% dig out all keywords defined in all features.
 1510:     ResWordFun =
 1511:         fun('maybe') -> true;
 1512:            ('else') -> true;
 1513:            (Other) -> erl_scan:reserved_word(Other)
 1514:         end,
 1515:     Options = [{reserved_word_fun,ResWordFun}],
 1516:     case erl_scan:tokens(Cont0, String, Line, Options) of
 1517:         {done, {ok, Tokens, EndLine}, Chars} ->
 1518:             {ok, Form} = erl_parse:parse_form(Tokens),
 1519:             parse_forms2(Chars, [], EndLine, [Form | Forms]);
 1520:         {more, Cont} when element(4, Cont) =:= [] ->
 1521:             %% extra spaces after forms...
 1522:             parse_forms2([], Cont, Line, Forms);
 1523:         {more, Cont} ->
 1524:             %% final dot needs a space...
 1525:             parse_forms2(" ", Cont, Line, Forms)
 1526:     end.
 1527: 
 1528: pp_expr(Bin) ->
 1529:     pp_expr(Bin, none).
 1530: 
 1531: %% Final dot is added.
 1532: pp_expr(Bin, Options) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 1533:     pp_expr(to_list(Bin, Options), Options);
 1534: pp_expr(List, Options) when is_list(List) ->
 1535:     PP1 = (catch parse_and_pp_expr(List, 0, Options)),
 1536:     PPneg = (catch parse_and_pp_expr(List, -1, Options)),
 1537:     PP2 = (catch parse_and_pp_expr(PPneg, 0, Options)),
 1538:     if
 1539:         PP1 =:= PP2 -> % same line numbers
 1540:             case
 1541:                 (test_max_line(PP1) =:= ok) and (test_new_line(PPneg) =:= ok)
 1542:             of
 1543:                 true ->
 1544:                     ok;
 1545:                 false ->
 1546:                     not_ok
 1547:             end;
 1548:         true ->
 1549:             not_ok
 1550:     end.
 1551: 
 1552: flat_parse_and_pp_expr(String, Indent, Options) ->
 1553:     lists:flatten(parse_and_pp_expr(String, Indent, Options)).
 1554: 
 1555: parse_and_pp_expr(String, Indent, Options) ->
 1556:     StringDot = lists:flatten(String) ++ ".",
 1557:     erl_pp:expr(parse_expr(StringDot), Indent, Options).
 1558: 
 1559: parse_expr(Chars) ->
 1560:     {ok, Tokens, _} = erl_scan:string(Chars, 1),
 1561:     {ok, [Expr]} = erl_parse:parse_exprs(Tokens),
 1562:     Expr.
 1563: 
 1564: to_list(Bin, Options) when is_list(Options) ->
 1565:     case proplists:get_value(encoding, Options) of
 1566:         unicode -> unicode:characters_to_list(Bin);
 1567:         encoding -> binary_to_list(Bin);
 1568:         undefined -> binary_to_list(Bin)
 1569:     end;
 1570: to_list(Bin, _Hook) ->
 1571:     binary_to_list(Bin).
 1572: 
 1573: test_new_line(String) ->
 1574:     case string:chr(String, $\n) of
 1575:         0 -> ok;
 1576:         _ -> not_ok
 1577:     end.
 1578: 
 1579: test_max_line(String) ->
 1580:     case max_line(String) of
 1581:         ML when ML > 100 ->
 1582:             {error, max_line_too_big, {ML,String}};
 1583:         _ML ->
 1584:             ok
 1585:     end.
 1586: 
 1587: max_line(String) ->
 1588:     lists:max([0 | [length(Sub) ||
 1589:                        Sub <- string:tokens(String, "\n"),
 1590:                        string:substr(Sub, 1, 5) =/= "-file"]]).
 1591: 
 1592: filename(Name, Config) when is_atom(Name) ->
 1593:     filename(atom_to_list(Name), Config);
 1594: filename(Name, Config) ->
 1595:     filename:join(?privdir, Name).
 1596: 
 1597: fail() ->
 1598:     ct:fail(failed).
 1599: 
 1600: assert_same(Expected) when is_list(Expected) ->
 1601:     Actual = binary_to_list(iolist_to_binary(parse_and_pp_forms(Expected, []))),
 1602:     case Expected == Actual of
 1603:       true -> ok;
 1604:       false -> error({Expected, Actual})
 1605:     end.
